thread.title: Clean Bandit star Neil Milan hits out at "f**ked up" rape compliments - Music
thread.title_full: Clean Bandit star Neil Milan hits out at "f**ked up" rape compliments - Music News - Digital Spy

author: Lewis Corner
title: Clean Bandit star Neil Milan hits out at "f**ked up" rape compliments - Music
text: Clean Bandit's Neil Milan has found himself as the heartthrob of the group after their chart-topping success, but there's one type of attention-seeking tactic used by fans that he's rightly fed-up of.The violin-playing star has hit out at Twitter followers using offensive language as a form of flattery, namely telling him that they want to "rape" him. "There is not aNYthing flattering, cute or attractive in being told by someone that they want to rape you. it's gross and f**ked up," Milan tweeted.A large majority of Clean Bandit's fans were very quick to support Neil Milan's outburst, proving that it's just a minority who think it's acceptable to use such language as a compliment.there is not aNYthing flattering, cute, or attractive in being told by someone that they want to rape you it's gross and fucked upâ€” Neil Milan (@neil_milan) October 4, 2015Chvrches frontwoman Lauren Mayberry recently hit back at misogynistic trolls on internet forum 4chan, after she was labelled a "whore", "bitch" and "slut" for appearing with wet hair in a music video.Clean Bandit achieved global popularity with their 2014 hit 'Rather Be', which was followed by Top 5 singles 'Extraordinary', 'Real Love' and 'Stronger'.
